messages.content: Hello, In this part of the interview process we will start with your resume round. Are you ready?
How are you brother?
Please let me know when you're ready.
Let's skip to the next question.
Please let me know when you're ready.
Okay Let's Start Now!
Can you introduce yourself?
Okay Let's Start Now!
Please stay focused on the interview.
What's the time left?
It should be visible on your screen.
Okay, My name is Jeff.
Could you elaborate more on this?
I am currently living in Chennai, India. My hobbies include playing basketball, cricket and tennis sometimes. I like coding a bit and have taken part in some hackathons once in a while.
Nice, Jeff. I could not find any project or experience in your resume. I can see that you've mentioned PostgreSQL as your skill. Could you tell me more about it?
Yes, sure.
Go ahead.
I've used it in a recent project that I've done. It's honestly very useful for complex queries.
Nice, Jeff. What is pgAdmin in PostgreSQL?
pgAdmin is sort of a handy utility that comes with the PostgreSQL installation, and it allows us to do regular database-related tasks through a graphical interface.
Correct, Jeff. How can you add new values to a certain table?
PostgreSQL uses the standard INSERT INTO statement to add data to your SQL table.
Great, Jeff. How can you delete a database in PostgreSQL?
give me some time.
Sure, take your time.
To delete a database in PostgreSQL, use the DROP BAD command.
Your answer is not satisfactory. Please try again.
To delete a database in PostgreSQL, use the DROP DATABASE command.
Correct, Jeff. I can see that you've mentioned Rust as your skill. Could you tell me more about it?
No, get lost kid.
This may carry a negative impression in the evaluation.
How was my answer to the previous question?
You will be able to see the results once this interview ends.
How was my answer to the previous question?
You will be able to see the results once this interview ends.
I said, get lost!
As I didn't find any suitable response from you, moving on to the next question. What is borrowing in Rust?
In Rust, borrowing refers to an activity where a program can get temporary access to a resource, such as a variable, without assuming permanent ownership of the resource.
Correct, Jeff. What is a lifetime in Rust?
Could you tell me if my previous answer was good?
You will be able to see the results once this interview ends.
Could you tell me if my previous answer was good or bad?
You will be able to see the results once this interview ends.
Could you tell me if my previous answer was good or bad?
Could I answer the previous question?
No it's not possible. Please continue with current question.
I told you to get lost then!
This may carry a negative impression in the evaluation.
Hmmph
Okay, Jeff.Thank you for your time. You can click on exit to leave this interview. We will get back to you soon.
Let's skip to the next question.
You will be able to see the results as well as the feedback on EvaluAItor dashboard. Goodbye and have a good day ahead.
Let's skip to the next question.
You will be able to see the results as well as the feedback on EvaluAItor dashboard. Goodbye and have a good day ahead.
